ranked_diseases.explanation: Noonan Syndrome is associated with pulmonic stenosis and cafe-au-lait spots, although freckling is less common but can occur.
Neurofibromatosis type 1 commonly presents with multiple cafe-au-lait spots and freckling, but pulmonic stenosis is not a typical feature.
LEOPARD Syndrome can present with pulmonic stenosis and cafe-au-lait spots, but freckling is less commonly reported.
Cardiofaciocutaneous Syndrome can include pulmonic stenosis and skin abnormalities, but cafe-au-lait spots and freckling are less common.
Costello Syndrome may include pulmonic stenosis and skin changes, but cafe-au-lait spots and freckling are not typical features.
